Divine Nature.quote: Deus est summum bonum - God is the highest good. (Augustine, De Natura Boni)

Divine Essence.quote: Deus est actus purus - God is pure act. (Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologica I, Q.3)

Divine Being.quote: Ipsum Esse Subsistens - The Self-Subsistent Being Itself. (Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologica I, Q.4)

Divine Unity.quote: Deus est unus - God is one. (Lateran IV Council, 1215)

Divine Trinity.quote: Una substantia, tres personae - One substance, three persons. (Tertullian, Adversus Praxean)

Divine Perfection.quote: Deus est quo nihil maius cogitari potest - God is that than which nothing greater can be thought. (Anselm, Proslogion)

Divine Wisdom.quote: O altitudo divitiarum sapientiae et scientiae Dei - O the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! (Romans 11:33)

Divine Knowledge.quote: Omnia nuda et aperta sunt oculis eius - All things are naked and open to His eyes. (Hebrews 4:13)

Divine Will.quote: Fiat voluntas tua - Thy will be done. (Matthew 6:10)

Divine Love.quote: Deus caritas est - God is love. (1 John 4:8)

Divine Providence.quote: In omnibus providentia Dei - In all things the providence of God. (Augustine, De Civitate Dei)

Divine Justice.quote: Iustus Dominus in omnibus viis suis - The Lord is just in all His ways. (Psalm 145:17)

Divine Mercy.quote: Misericordias Domini in aeternum cantabo - I will sing of the mercies of the Lord forever. (Psalm 89:1)

Divine Creation.quote: Ex nihilo fit - From nothing it becomes. (Augustine, De Genesi ad litteram)

Divine Governance.quote: Deus gubernat omnia - God governs all things. (Thomas Aquinas, Summa Contra Gentiles III)

Divine Presence.quote: Deus est ubique - God is everywhere. (Augustine, Confessions)

Divine Eternity.quote: Tu autem idem ipse es, et anni tui non deficient - But you are the same, and your years will not fail. (Psalm 102:27)

Divine Immutability.quote: Ego Dominus et non mutor - I am the Lord and I change not. (Malachi 3:6)

Divine Simplicity.quote: Deus est summe simplex - God is supremely simple. (Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologica I, Q.3)

Divine Beauty.quote: Pulchritudo tam antiqua et tam nova - Beauty so ancient and so new. (Augustine, Confessions X)

Divine Truth.quote: Ego sum via et veritas et vita - I am the way, the truth, and the life. (John 14:6)

Divine Light.quote: Deus lux est - God is light. (1 John 1:5)

Divine Glory.quote: Soli Deo gloria - Glory to God alone. (Reformed tradition)

Divine Sovereignty.quote: Domini est regnum - The kingdom is the Lord's. (Psalm 22:28)

Divine Law.quote: Lex aeterna - Eternal law. (Augustine, De Libero Arbitrio)

Divine Grace.quote: Gratia Dei sum quod sum - By the grace of God I am what I am. (1 Corinthians 15:10)

Divine Order.quote: Ordo est parium dispariumque rerum sua cuique loca tribuens dispositio - Order is the disposition of equal and unequal things, giving to each its proper place. (Augustine, De Civitate Dei)

Divine Infinity.quote: Deus est infinitus - God is infinite. (Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologica I, Q.7)
